sentence.text: Hyperpolarization-coenzyme A biosynthetic processivated cyclic nucleotide-gated channels (HCN) can act as pacemakers in the brain making them strong candidates for driving aberrant hypersynchronous network activity seen in epilepsy.
However, only recently have genetic studies demonstrated sequence variation in protein homotetramerization and cellular response to cAMP genes associated with human epilepsy.
These include a triple proline deletion in cellular response to cAMP that increases channel function and occurs more often in patients with febrile seizure syndromes.
